content:
New Album Out Soon! # I thought it up whilst rounding upon my patients. It occured to me after a recent consult for a rather aged Caucasian female with a minimally impacted femorl neck fracture. Obviously, she needs surgical management; I stepped in to ensure she had adequate glycemic control for her long-standing untreated diabetes. I put her on a sliding scale insulin. Her HTN is reasonably well controlled, so we’ll keep her on home meds. Pain management per orthopedics of course.
Jonathon Taylor, Not a Doctor
title: Super Senior
